summary:
Assistant Professor at Erasmus Medical Center in The Netherlands, working on elucidating the molecular mechanisms of cancer progression, aiming to turn laboratory discoveries into personalized cancer therapies. 
I am interested in characterizing the mode of function of HER2, and its partner HER3, in the pathological state of HER2 overexpression, in order to define a mechanistic basis for the development of novel therapeutic agents for the treatment of HER2-amplified cancers.
As a postdoc fellow at the University of California San Francisco, I revealed new paradigms in cell signaling and cancer resistance in breast and colorectal cancers(published in Nature Cancer, Cancer Research and Oncogene, among others). In 2019, I established my own research group at Erasmus MC supported by the Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions Programme and the Dutch Research Council. Our aim is to uncover the impact of aberrant tumor glycosylation on the efficacy of targeted therapies integrating clinical data, co-culture 3D immune-cancer spheroids and high-content live-imaging. Specifically, my lab is currently deciphering the impact of altered glycosylation on the response to HER2-targeting agents in breast cancer, including a recent and promising therapeutic agent developed by AstraZeneca.
My experience in the US and Europe has enabled me to establish fruitful collaborations with international experts and the pharmaceutical industry. I have also actively participated in numerous conferences and outreach activities, including fundraising events and science communication events. And I am also a lecturer of the Molecular Medicine Master program at Erasmus Medical Center.

awards.title: Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions (MSCA) Fellowship
awards.description: Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions is a set of major research fellowships created by the European Union/European Commission to support research in the European Research Area. The Marie Skłodowska-Curie Actions are among Europe's most competitive and prestigious research and innovation fellowships.

awards.description: Abstract "HER2-amplification overcomes the requirement for HER3" was selected for podium presentation during the resistance and recurrence session at the Hematology/Oncology Research Retreat at UCSF.

awards.title: Best Talk Award
awards.description: Novel strategy to target the undruggable HER3 in human cancers: blocking its translocation into the endoplasmic reticulum.

awards.title: Nominated for participation in the AAAS/Science Program for Excellence in Science.
awards.description: Nominated by Dr. Ashworth for participation in the AAAS/Science Program for Excellence in Science, which recognizes excellence in scientific research among graduate students, medical students, and postdocs.This program rewards deserving graduate students, medical students, and postdocs working in the life sciences with a two-year sponsored membership in AAAS/Science.

awards.title: Best poster in the Molecular Biology category
awards.description: Best poster award at the UCSF Breast Oncology Program Scientific Retreat. The 2015 two-day conference included four sessions with scientific themes focused on: genome integrity and DNA repair, imaging for therapeutic effect, novel approaches to cancer therapeutic, risk stratification.

awards.title: Ramón Areces Fellowship
awards.description: In the pursuit of excellence in the research process, the Ramón Areces Foundation sponsors scholarship programmes for study abroad to enable Spanish post-graduate students to study at some of the world's leading research centres.
